Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] ILRepack the NuGet.* Tasks Dependencies." (#1694) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
`ResolveAssemblies` is throwing the following error on
a newer mono (2018-04).

	error : Could not load file or assembly 'NuGet.ProjectModel, Version=4.6.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' or one of its dependencies.

This is because we took a dependency on NuGet.ProjectModel 4.6 and
the newer mono has 4.7. This results in the error above.

Now we cannot always be sure which version of the NuGet assemblies
will be installed since users are able to upgrade mono independently.
So this PR will use the `ILRepack` NuGet to package up the dependencies
we need so that `Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks` contains all the
correct assemblies it needs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Build warning: Name cannot begin with the '$' character" (#1698) at xamarin/xamarin-android

1. Create a new Android project
2. Add a Nuget reference to Xamarin.Firebase.Iid, version 60.1142.1
3. Build

Repro project: [DollarSignProb.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2014904/DollarSignProb.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Enabled DefaultOutputPaths targets for msbuild only" (#1697) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
xbuild is not being compatible with the property evaluations
we're doing in the .targets => so we're only offering the output
paths improvements to the users that are using MsBuild.

It also prevents that CI builds don't fail because of this change.

And also adding the ability to disable it by setting the
EnableDefaultOutputPaths property to false.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Fix bundled app crash on startup" (#1683) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1651

Recent update to mono brought in changes in the code generated by `mkbundle`
when dealing with AOT. Unfortunately, the changes require the bundle to be able
to find the `mono_jit_set_aot_mode` runtime function which isn't exported in the
Xamarin.Android up and thus the loading of the bundle crashes on startup with
the following message:

    dlopen failed: cannot locate symbol "mono_jit_set_aot_mode" referenced by libmonodroid_bundle_app.so

To fix this we need to augment the bundle's `mono_mkbundle_init` function in
generated code to take a third parameter - pointer to the abovementioned
function. With the current code this requires a set of rather ugly changes, as
seen in this commit, but it makes the application not crash on start and is the
fastest way to fix the issue right now.

This is a short-term fix, a long-term one will be presented at a later time.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Core] StakLayout Padding update issue" (#2763) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
 The `Padding` of the `StackLayout` causes a change in the stack size but changes of `Padding` does not trigger MeasureChanged. So Size of StackLayout does not update until re-layouting


* `Padding` affects the `StackLayout` size calculation.
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/blob/882bf07917bea57b93d0d9becd768dcab739c26f/Xamarin.Forms.Core/StackLayout.cs#L71-L83

* But MeasureChanged does not trigger
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/blob/882bf07917bea57b93d0d9becd768dcab739c26f/Xamarin.Forms.Core/Layout.cs#L103-L106

Need to override `IPaddingElement.OnPaddingPropertyChanged` on StackLayout like below
``` C#
		void IPaddingElement.OnPaddingPropertyChanged(Thickness oldValue, Thickness newValue)
		{
			InvalidateMeasureInternal(InvalidationTrigger.MeasureChanged);
		}
```

### Steps to Reproduce
 1. Update `Padding` of `StackLayout`

### Expected Behavior
 StackLayout size should be changed and update looks
### Actual Behavior
 Does not update looks

### Basic Information
- Version with issue: master of github
- Last known good version: No

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1029155/40215801-afb877c0-5a9d-11e8-8b1b-f5f4206d54a6.gif)

Events.RelatedBody:
Our existing Xamarin.iOS project is in the process of a major refactor. Part of this has included relying more on NuGet, although I am not certain that is this the root of the problem.  Currently our project builds and runs fine on the simulator, but if we try to build for a device we get 
```
error MT0099 : Internal error : Not all assemblies for Xamarin.Sdk have link tasks.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Neverending build on device (due to Mac Agent disconnecting?)" (#3818) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Ok, this is driving my crazy, iPhone device build stopped working **at all**.

When I try to build my Xamarin.iOS project in the latest Visual Studio in iPhone-device configuration, it never finishes building - does not fail, does not succeed, just keeps building.  

The problem might be that I am getting those logs in Xamarin output, it repeats every few minutes:

> Connection to '192.168.15.128' completed successfully
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is not connected...
> Starting registered Agents: Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Agent Build 4.9.0.752...
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is running
> Build 4.9.0.752 started
> Starting registered Agents: ...
> The Agents have been started successfully
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is not connected...
> Starting registered Agents: Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Agent Build 4.9.0.752...
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is running
> Build 4.9.0.752 started
> Starting registered Agents: ...
> The Agents have been started successfully
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is not connected...
> Starting registered Agents: Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Agent Build 4.9.0.752...
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is running
> Build 4.9.0.752 started
> Starting registered Agents: ...
> The Agents have been started successfully

When I do iPhone Simulator build, it takes 1-3 minutes, succeeds and deploys OK.

But even when building for the simulator, I sometimes (like every 20 minutes I guess) get to situation when after successful build, I am presented with the Mac Agent connection dialog, where my Mac has the 'connected' icon, but when I close the dialog, I get some popup alert that active connection is needed - so what I need to do is Disconnect and Connect again in order to be able to deploy to the simulator.
This little issue is happening a few weeks, it is present since a few releases back. **But the neverending-build issue is only happening since I updated VS to 15.6.4** (but I have skipped a few releases between, like 15.6.2 and 3 I guess, so it might not be related exactly to 15.6.4).

Please also note that I have tried changing many of the properties in iOS project settings, tried rebooting windows, rebooting OS X, rebooting iPhone... basically spend whole day trying to make it work. And sometimes it actually did build (like 3 times during the whole day I guess), but there were erros with deploying (I was trying on iPhone 4 iOS 7, which used to work, like kAMDIncorrectArchitectureError). Then again the next builds were failing.
Also once in the million neverending tries, the build actually failed with error `Invalid bitcode signature`.

<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Visual Studio
2. Pair with Mac Server 
3. Pair is successful > Crash occurs seconds after

### Expected Behavior
VS doesn't crash

### Actual Behavior
VS crashes

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[mono2018-04]ThreadPrincipalTests.PrincipalFlowsToAsyncTask failure on device" (#4097) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update System to xamarin.macios from mono2018-04 branch, 11.11.0.398 (master: 1e1a347b) 
2. Execute mscorlib tests on device

### Expected Behavior
All tests pass. 
### Actual Behavior
[FAIL] ThreadPrincipalTests.PrincipalFlowsToAsyncTask : System.NotSupportedException : Linked Away
### Environment

```
Operating System: Mac OS X 10.13.4
Mono version: 5.14.0.84 (ef73a4955df)  (2018-05-15 21:55:01 -04:00)
XA version: 8.3.0.19 (HEAD/342b2ce96) 
XI version: 11.11.0.398 (master: 1e1a347b) 
XM version: 4.5.0.398 (master: 1e1a347b)  (2018-05-15 11:45:38 -04:00)
XS version: 7.5.1.22 (60442dd)  (2018-05-14 21:43:39 -04:00)
[Device] Name: XQA-AppleTV-2, Identifier: b4bdf4adae9fadc66c4ed145b08d35266ec7262c, Version: 9.2.1, Arch: , FormFactor: AppleTV, PairedPhone: 

```

### Build Logs

Test Logs: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/mscorlib-tvos02-28-59b4bdf4adae9fadc66c4ed145b08d35266ec7262c02-28-59-481215a1262b4887ba06a12085cd8b24.zip

Build log: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-d44aac155d8d497badf3dcc5efad37a0.txt

### Example Project (If Possible)

xamarin-macios/tests/bcl-test/mscorlib/mscorib.csproj
